datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS-A_primary_genome_RSRC

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM3IMSS_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Entamoeba histolytica HM-3:IMSS genome sequence and annotation
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Entamoeba histolytica strain HM-3:IMSS.
This strain was isolated from the aspirate of an amebic liver abscess in adult human male, Mexico City, Mexico, 1972 and corresponds to ATCC 30890. The genome was sequenced using Illumina methods to a 134.99 coverage. It was assembled using Newbler v. 2.5.3.

datasetPresenter.name: nfowATCC30863_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Naegleria fowleri ATCC 30863 genome sequence and annotation
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Naegleria fowleri strain ATCC 30863. The ATCC designates this strain as Naegleria fowleri Carter under the product number 30863. This strain was isolated from an 8-year-old human male, Charleston, SC, 1978.

Genome Sequencing:
The genome was sequenced using both Illumina HiSeq 2000 and Roche 454 GS FLX technology. In total, over 500 million reads were de novo assembled into 1,124 scaffolds with an average coverage of 770x and an N50 of 136,406. First, DNA was sequenced with the Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform, resulting in approximately 116 million 100-bp paired-end reads with an insert size of 300 bp. The de novo assembly of these short 100-bp reads was facilitated by 454 backbone sequencing, providing approximately 350,000 single reads with an average length of 378 bp. Finally, the assembly was improved with information from a mate-pair library composed of approximately 400 million Illumina reads with an insert size of 3 kb. The nuclear genome is 29,619,856 bp in size and is AT-rich, with a GC content of only 35.4%. The calculation of the genome size via flow cytometry indicated that the N. fowleri genome is approximately 66 Mb. Based on the 29,619,856-bp size of the de novo-assembled genome, the genome of N. fowleri is considered diploid.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_microarrayExpression_Alterzon_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Trophozoite Gene Expression During Glucose Starvation
datasetPresenter.summary: Effects of glucose starvation on gene expression in E. histolytica trophozoites were determined using microarray analysis.
datasetPresenter.description:
Microarray analysis was used to compare growth conditions in E. histolytica HM1:IMSS trophozoites:
1. control - high glucose growth medium
2. starvation - low glucose medium for one month
3. recovery - high glucose medium for 3 hours after starvation

Two million trophozoites growing under control, starvation or recovery conditions were recovered by centrifugation (550 g). Purified RNA was converted to cDNA, labeled and hybridized to EH-IP2008 microarray. Three independent biological replicates were performed, each having two technical replicates hybridized in dye swap.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisRahman_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Genome sequence for Entamoeba histolytica Rahman strain.

datasetPresenter.name: aastUnknown_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome seqeunce for Acanthamoeba astronyxis Unknown strain
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence for Acanthamoeba astronyxis Unknown strain.

This strain is ATCC 30137 and was isolated from soil in California in 1944. Axenic cultures were grown in PYB culture medium (ATCC 711) and at 25 degrees Celsius. DNA was isolated using a Qiagen Genomic DNA isolation kit. Fragment genomic libraries (400bp) were sequenced on the Illumina Hiseq platform.

link.text: NCBI Nucleotide record (Whole genome shotgun sequencing project)

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_microarrayExpression_Gilchrist_GSE28883_G3-HM1_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: E. histolytica G3 v. HM1:IMSS Transcript Expression Array Profiles
datasetPresenter.description:
Changes in the transcriptome of Entamoeba histolytica accompany the epigenetic silencing of the amoebapore gene In E. histolytica G3 transfectants, transcriptional silencing of the amoebapore gene (Ehap-a) is accompanied by the down-regulation of two other members of the saposin-like (SAPLIP) gene family (Ehap-b, and EhSaplip1). In the current work, comparison of the G3 transcriptome with that of the parent HM-1:IMSS strain has identified an additional 12 transcripts that were down regulated and 60 which were upregulated at least 7 fold. To investigate this phenomena in more depth, one of the transcripts (TIGR 459.m00030) which was increased >200 fold was further investigated. This E. histolytica specific transcript has the potential to encode a 66 amino acid protein however antibodies raised against a synthetic N-terminal peptide of the 459.m gene did not recognize any such protein in either G3 or HM-1:IMSS amoeba lysates. Treatment of G3 transfectants with the proteasome inhibitor MG-132 to prevent rapid 459.m protein degradation did not result in any detectable 459.m protein. Neither did the transfection of the parent HM-1:IMSS with an expression construct in which the Ehactin gene promoter was used to greatly increase the level of the 459.m transcript. However, transfectants in which the 459.m ORF sequence was placed downstream the GST gene, expressed a fused protein. To determine if the increase in this non-coding mRNA were due to changes in the stability of the 459.m transcript or increased transcription, reporter constructs were generated. The reporter gene was both placed directly 3'' of the 459.m gene promoter or fused to the C-terminal sequence of the 459.m ORF. The 459.m promoter, in isolation, was weak and no difference in reporter expression was observed in either G3 or HM-1:IMSS transfectants. The genetic context of the 459.m gene was examined and retroposon elements (EhERE1 and EhSINE) were discovered downstream suggesting the possibility of their involvement in the observed transcription changes.

Authors: Rivka Bracha, Carol A. Gilchrist and David Mirelman

templateInjector.prop: Sample Type 1. G3 (Ehap-a silenced strain) 2. HM1:IMSS (Parent strain)

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_microarrayExpression_Gilchrist_Singh_intestinal_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: E. histolytica HM-1:IMSS Intestinal Colonization/Invasion Array Profiles
datasetPresenter.description: An Affymetrix platform gene expression array was designed for this analysis that included probe sets for 9435 open reading frames (ORFs) and 9066 5' and 3' flanking regions. Transcripts were detected for > 80% of all ORFs. A total of 523 transcripts (5.2% of all E. histolytica genes) were significantly changed in amoebae isolated from the intestine on Days 1 and 29 after infection: 326 and 109 solely on Days 1 and 29, and 88 on both days. Quantitative real-time reverse transcriptase PCR confirmed these changes in 11/12 genes tested using mRNA isolated from an additional six mice.

link.text: Data Taken From Geo Dataset GSE8484

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_microarrayExpression_Gilchrist_Singh_stage_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: E. histolytica HM-1:IMSS Stage Conversion Array Profiles
datasetPresenter.description:
Gene expression in Entamoeba histolytica cysts and trophozoites
RNA was isolated from E. histolytica parasites recently derived from human patients and grown in xenic culture (Robinson's media) for 1-8 weeks. These recently isolated cultures contained a mixture of trophozoites and cysts (as assayed by staining with calcofluor). Two different strains, isolated from different patients, were used. Gene expression in these strains was compared to gene expression in multiple E. histolytica strains (HMI:IMSS, Rahman and 200:NIH) that contained only trophozoites, which had been grown in axenic culture (TYI-S-33) for > 10 years, using a full genome Affymetrix-platform microarray. Multiple lines of evidence suggest that many genes differentially expressed between these two conditions (recent isolates vs. long term lab growth) are developmentally regulated.

All samples were isolated using Trizol and samples other than the cyst containing clinical isolate samples were further purified with the Qiagen RNeasy kit (clinical isolates produced insufficient RNA for cleanup). Samples GSM154008 (HM1replicate 3) and GSM154011 (Rahman replicate 3) were amplified using the SPIA protocol, and hybridized and scanned at VBI. All other samples were processed entirely by Stanford PAN facility. Samples GSM154022, GSM154023, and GSM154024 (the cyst containing clinical samples) were amplified 2 rounds using the standard affy T7 procedure. All others had sufficient RNA and only underwent the standard affy in vitro transcription labeling protocol.

link.text: Data Taken From Geo Dataset GSE6648

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_HTS_SNP_Weedall_SOLID_htsSNPs_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Aligned genomic sequence reads - Multiple E. histolytica Strains
datasetPresenter.summary: Whole genome sequencing of multiplen of 9 E. Histolytica strains
datasetPresenter.description: ABI SOLiD sequence reads of multiple E. histolytica strains were provided by Gareth Weedall and Neil Hall, of the Institute of Integrative Biology, Liverpool. Reads were aligned to the E. histolytica HM-1:IMSS reference genome using Bowtie and SNPs called using VarScan.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Ujang_Membrane_Cytosolic_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Membrane and Cytosolic proteomes by 3 extraction methods
datasetPresenter.summary: Entamoeba histolytica HM1:IMSS proteome analysis of membrane and cytosolic fractions
datasetPresenter.description:
Entamoeba histolytica HM1:IMSS proteome analysis of membrane and cytosolic fractions using two mass spectrometry systems, namely LC-MALDI MS/MS and LC-ESI MS/MS to identify proteins obtained by three different methods, ProteoExtract (Calbiochem), ProteoPrep (Sigma) and a conventional method described in Teixeira & Huston (2008).
Membrane fractions and cytosolic fractions of Entamoeba histolytica trophozoites were extracted via the three extraction methods mentioned. Subsequently, acetone precipitation was carried out for ProteoExtract and ProteoPrep samples as a mean of buffer exchange. The protein samples were subjected to insolution - trypsin digestion.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Marion_Proteomics_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteome of Human Serum Coated Magnetic Bead-Purified Phagosomes from Trophozoite
datasetPresenter.description:
Proteome of Phagosomes from E. histolytica trophozoites purified using human serum coated magnetic beads.
Phagosomes were purified from E. histolytica wild type and myosin IB over-expressing (MyoIB+) trophozoites using human serum-coated magnetic beads. Phagosomes from wild type parasites were purified following a 3 minute incubation with beads, and phagosomes from MyoIB+ parasites were purified following 5 or 15 minute incubations. Proteins were analyzed by liquid chromatography and tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Glycosylation_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Concanavalin A-enriched Glycoproteins from Trophozoite (Carpentieri et. al.)
Total protein extract (soluble fraction) from E. histolytica trophozoites was purified over a Concanavalin A column followed by tryptic digestions and N-glycanase F hydrolysis (to release N-linked glycans and identify glycosylation sites). Proteins were analyzed by liquid chromatography and tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Markiewicz_Proteomics_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Purified Uropods from Trophozoite (Markiewicz et. al.)
Uropod extruded fractions were purified following a Concanavalin A incubation of E. histolytica trophozoites. Purification was performed by successive centrifugation and final pellet was processed for proteomics analysis. Proteins were analyzed by liquid chromatography and tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Huston_phagosome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Magnetic Bead-Purified Phagosomes from Trophozoite (Boettner et. al.)
Ingested carboxylated magnetic beads within intact phagosomes from E. histolytica were separated from amebic lysate and subjected to delipidation and mass spectrometry sequencing. Phagosome preparations were performed at 0, 5, 10, and 60 minutes following centrifugation of the beads into contact with trophozoites. In addition lysed amoeba were incubated with beads and subjected to the same steps to account for background binding to the carboxylated beads. This resultant proteome identified many proteins previously associated with phagocytosis in the literature, including: the galactose binding lectin, small GTPases, hydrolytic proteins, cytoskeleton proteins, and endoplasmic reticulum proteins.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_massSpec_Ujang_ESproteome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Mass spec analysis using two methods (LC-ESI-MS/MS and LC-MALDI-TOF/TOF) was performed on Entamoeba histolytica HM1:IMSS trophozoite excretory-secretory (ES) proteins. Two replicates were analysed with ESI, and three replicates with MALDI TOF-TOF. The authors considered proteins to be significant if they met one of the following criteria: a protein that was detected in both replicates using LC-ESI-MS/MS; a protein that was detected in at least two replicates using LC-MALDI-TOF/TOF; and a protein that was detected in only one replicate but detected by both mass-spectrometry systems

datasetPresenter.name: (.*)_genomeFeature_repeatElements_GFF3_RSRC$
datasetPresenter.description:
Repeat elements were mapped in Entamoeba species: E. histolytica HM-1:MMS, E. invadens IP1, and E. dispar SAW760 (LINE, SINE, ERE).
SINE elements = Short INterspersed repetitive Elements, LINE elements = Long INterspersed repetitive Element, ERE = Entamoeba repeat element.
datasetPresenter.usage: These data are available as a GBrowse track and can be displayed in context with the genome.

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_Guillen_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptomes of HM1:IMSS and Rahman strain trophozoites
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptomes of virulent Entamoeba histolytica HM1:IMSS and non-virulent Rahman strains were determined by Illumina RNA sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description: The transcriptomes of E. histolytica HM1:IMSS (virulent) and E. histolytica Rahman (non-virulent) were determined by RNA sequencing. Trophozoites in log phase of growth were used to prepare paired-end cDNA libraries. cDNA fragments of ~200 bp were purified from each library and sequenced according manufacturer’s instructions (Illumina HiSeq2000, Illumina).

datasetPresenter.name: nfowATCC30863_Pathogenic_Trophozoite_Trascriptome_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome of Naegleria fowleri ATCC 30863 trophozoites.
datasetPresenter.description: The transcriptome of Naegleria fowleri ATCC 30863 trophozoites was determined by RNA sequencing. RNA was sequenced using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform, resulting in approximately 229 million 100-bp paired-end reads. The reads from RNA sequencing are deposited in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank under accession SRX553040

datasetPresenter.name: einvIP1_Singh_Encyst_Excyst_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: RNA-Seq analysis of transcriptional changes during the complete developmental cycle of E. invadens (encystation and excystation).
datasetPresenter.description:
Whole transcriptome sequencing of Entamoeba invadens IP-1 during encystation and excystation. The goal of the project was to identify changes to the transcriptome during development.

RNA was isolated from trophozoites, from encysting parasites (at 8, 24, 48 and 72 hours after transfer to encystation media) and from excysting parasites (2 and 8 hours after induction of excystation), converted to cDNA, and sequenced on a SOLiD platform. RNA-seq data was used to refine gene models, find potential unannotated genes, and identify genes that are developmentally regulated.

templateInjector.prop: Trophozoites;8hr encysting;24hr encysting;48hr encysting;72hr encysting;2hr excysting;8hr excysting
Trophozoites, 8 hour encysting parasites, 24 hour encysting parasites, 48 hour encysting parasites, 72 hour encysting parasites, 2 hour excysting parasites and 8 hour excysting parasites

datasetPresenter.name: ehisHM1IMSS_smallNcRna_Singh_Small_RNA_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary:
RNA sequencing of small RNAs that co-precipitate with the Argonaute 2-2 protein in virulent E. histolytica strain HM1:IMSS and small RNAs from the avirulent strain Rahman.
At views > 3kb a plot of coverage across the genome is seen.
At < 3kb, individual alignments can be viewed, with sequence information visible at <100bp.
datasetPresenter.description:
To characterise the E. histolytica small RNA population associated with Argonaute 2-2, a component of RNAi pathway, the RNA species that co-precipitate with Argonaute 2-2 were sequenced from the virulent HM1:IMSS strain and compared to a small RNA-enriched library from the avirulent Rahman strain.

Small RNA cloning was based on a previously published protocol for 5' phosphate independent cloning (CIP + PNK method). For the Argonaute 2-2 IP library, RNA was extracted from the IP material and directly ligated to the 3'-adaptor oligonucleotide. Material was size-fractionated, treated with CIP and PNK, and ligated to the 5' adaptor. For the Rahman library no Argonaute 2-2 immunoprecipitation was performed. Total RNA was enriched for small RNA species, size fractionated and the 15-30 nt band was excised. Adaptor ligation was carried out as for the HM1:IMSS library. For both libraries, the ligated RNA was reverse-transcribed, amplified using 454 primers, purified and sequenced using the 454 pipeline.

After removing the adaptors, reads were mapped using bowtie2 in local mode. Local mode employs soft-clipping which maps a subset of the read if the full read cannot be aligned. Reads whose full length did not map may appear to be trimmed and results for these reads will differ from the publication.
